p: Long-term consumption of A. cepa produced a preventive effect on the incidence of vascular and heart diseases, neurodegenerative disorders and cataract formation (Albishi etÂ al. 2013). Other pharmacological properties shown for this plant include improvement of kidney function (Bisen and Emerald 2016), and anthelmintic, aphrodisiac, carminative, emmenagogue, and expectorant activities; also, it has beneficial effects on dysmenorrhoea, vertigo, fainting, migraine, wounds, scars, keloids, pain and swelling after bee or wasp stings, and is used for treatment of bruises, earache, jaundice, and pimples (Shri and Bora 2008).
